nodes.bodyText: The element to tap?
Won't it be confusing: having the tap step with duration only?

The questions I got are:

what duration will fit my app?
Is it 0?
is it something else?
How to choose?
If it 0 why I should even care?
In this case I would prefer to gather some statistic which duration suits most apps by default, but currently there is not such statistic, I mean that any default value is not proven to be suitable
I could add composite with duration 1s but I would prefer to not add integration tests for such composites since the underlying component is already covered
I propose to add one more step and use TouchAction.tap
one more step is added
Since the tap will be called only if the element exists why the tap performs a nullability check?
it's not really nullability check, it's just optional api which let us to inline tap invocation
You're checking element in TapActions
lin 43

In my understanding we have two layers of API, the first one - are steps for users, and the second one - for internal use, that's why I put null check into TapActions because it can be used in other places
Yep, and since API you're using provides null-safety no reason to use an optional?
base validation - is not the only way to get elements
if is not the only way to check null :)
located by -> located
I think now this abstraction doesn't make sense

in this implementation DURATION.ZERO used as a flag.
Can we use .tap(element(WebDriverUtil.unwrap(element, RemoteWebElement.class))); instead?
What is advantage? We don't really know how tap works under the hood, it may potentially add tap duration on the appium side
if some users want to tap with zero duration (I have no idea why, but taking into account appium it could be anything), then we shouldn't modify the action

The atomic actions performed are:
* press on the element
* wait for the duration
* release
